# sortBy

**Instance Property**

The sort descriptors that tell the fetch how to order its results.

## Declaration

```swift
var sortBy: [SortDescriptor<T>]
```

## Discussion

Use this property to specify how to arrange the collection of models that a fetch returns. For example, if your app defines a `Person` model, you may want to sort by the `surname` attribute, then by the `firstName` attribute. The fetch applies the sort descriptors in the same order as they appear in the array.

The default value is the array you specify when calling [doc://com.apple.SwiftData/documentation/SwiftData/FetchDescriptor/init(predicate:sortBy:)].

## Constraining the fetch

- **predicate**: The logical condition that determines whether the fetch includes a specific model in its results.
- **fetchLimit**: The maximum number of models the fetch can return.
- **fetchOffset**: The offset of the first matching model to fetch.
- **includePendingChanges**: A Boolean value that indicates whether, when the fetch runs, it matches against currently unsaved changes in the model context.
